FAQ.title: Frequently Asked Questions
FAQ.subtitle: Have questions? We have answers. If you can't find what you're looking for, feel free to contact us.

q1.question: How do I connect my OBD-II device?
q1.answer: To connect your OBD-II device, first locate the 16-pin port in your vehicle, usually under the dashboard. With the ignition off, plug the device in firmly.
q1.answer_long: To connect your OBD-II device, first locate the 16-pin port in your vehicle, usually under the dashboard near the steering wheel. With the ignition turned completely off, plug the device in firmly. Once connected, you can turn the ignition to the "On" position (without starting the engine) and launch our application to establish a wireless connection.

q2.question: Do you support all car brands?
q2.answer: Yes, our platform is compatible with all vehicles that are OBD-II compliant, which includes virtually all cars manufactured for sale after 1996.
q2.answer_long: Yes, our platform is compatible with all vehicles that are OBD-II compliant. This includes virtually all cars and light trucks manufactured for sale in Europe, the US, and Asia after 1996. We continuously update our database to support the latest vehicle models and protocols to ensure the widest possible coverage.

q3.question: How do I attract more clients?
q3.answer: A complete and professional profile is key. Add a high-quality photo, detail your experience, and encourage satisfied customers to leave reviews.
q3.answer_long: A complete and professional public profile is key to building trust. We recommend adding a high-quality profile picture, detailing your years of experience and certifications, and showcasing your workshop. Furthermore, encouraging satisfied customers to leave reviews on your profile will significantly boost your visibility and attract more clients through our platform's search.
